message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM

The paper proposes a deep learning-based segmentation strategy for quantification of left atrium and proximal pulmonary veins from MRI images. This involves the use of a multi-view convolutional neural network (CNN) with an adaptive fusion strategy and a new loss function. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the paper involves training the network from scratch using a large dataset of MRI images, which suggests the involvement of machine learning techniques. This makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories as well. The use of a neural network also suggests the involvement of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper involves the evaluation of the proposed method using a segmentation challenge, which suggests the involvement of cs.MM (Multimedia).
